result.execSummary:
The defendant Troy Walter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: With credit for 36 DAYS time served, with full Huber.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges during period of probation, bail to apply, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with drug dealers or or drug houses.

Court GRANTED expungement upon successful completion of all terms of probation, including no new law violations rising to the level of probable cause, and payment of all ordered costs, AFTER 15 MONTHS.

Absolute sobriety.
Provide a DNA sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Troy Walter

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 5 MONTHS in the House of Correction, with credit for 36 DAYS time served, with full Huber.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 12 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Absolute sobriety.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges during period of probation, bail to apply, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
-Provide DNA Sample.
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
-Attend School, no unexcused absences.
-No firearms/dangerous weapons.
-No contact with drug dealers or or drug houses.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court GRANTED expungement upon successful completion of all terms of probation, including no new law violations rising to the level of probable cause, and payment of all ordered costs, AFTER 15 MONTHS.

Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief

Defendant Troy Walter in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

15RM035621  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
07-29-2015

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Troy Walter not in court, in custody and not produced.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Scheduling conference held off the record.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 23.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Troy Walter in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.  Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests a scheduling conference date. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Defendant Troy Walter in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Troy Walter in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 45.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
